sub_title: Global Director – Customer Success and Engagement | Building relationships - understanding customers to help them achieving success
summary:
As a former academic researcher, with over 20 years of experience in product development, publishing, and academic & governmental relations, I have ample experience in building and maintaining networks around the globe (e.g. US, Europe, China, Japan, Brazil, Australia-NZ). These personal interactions allow me to acquire a deep-insight into a customer experience and consequently turn opportunities or concerns into new (or improved) products or services (from conception to product launch). 

I thrive on setting out long term global strategies with regards to outreach, networking, growth and revenue. I have extensive experience in leading international teams working at various locations and have a strong focus on people development. I work well under pressure, am very much result-driven and I have a passion for winning.

volunteer_experiences.description:
My “Publishers Without Borders” volunteer assignment in Tanzania (2015) focused on “digital publishing” with workshops and presentations for researchers throughout the country covering business models, rights management, international collaboration and ethics. These trainings help Tanzania to become a nation where science and scientific publishing are embedded in the universities and research institutions. The knowledge sharing will help to create a better-organized publishing industry in Tanzania.

The “Publishers Without Borders” program is part of the “Strengthening Tanzanian Publishing” project, a collaboration between the Elsevier Foundation, Voluntary-Service Overseas (VSO), INASP and the Tanzanian Commission for Science and Technology (COSTECH). The goal of the program is to support the development of indigenous academic and a digital publishing culture in Tanzania.

My personal story: http://www.elsevier.com/connect/scientific-publishing-in-tanzania-a-safi-sana-journey and related video: https://www.elsevier.com/connect/video-enhancing-reading-culture-and-research-output-in-tanzania
